All Classes

Class Description
ApiArgument
ApiArgument for event handling
ApiCaller
This class handles every connection to the OpenWeather API.
Important!
ApiListener
Api event listener interface.
Implement this interface whenever you need to handle ApiCaller events.
ApiResponse  
AsyncCaller
AsyncCaller lets you make asynchronous calls to the OpenWeather API.
Because you can't get responses directly form the AsyncCaller, you should add a listener using the addListener() method before any call is performed.
AsyncCaller.AsyncMethod  
Callable
Interface for Callable classes, used for forms event.
Caller
Abstract class for every ApiCaller in the program.
CityRecord
This class represents a City, and is stored as Json object in the Database.
Coordinates
Geo location coordinates.
DatabaseManager
This class handles the Database
DateLabelFormatter
Class used to format Dates
Debugger
A debugging class, used to print to System.out custom messages
EExclude
Enumeration for OneCall response fields exclusion
EMode
Enumeration for response mode.
EUnits
Enumeration for units.
ForecastResponse  
Form
Form generalized class.
FormListener  
Frame  
FrameManager
FrameManager is the main character on Form management for the CLI.
HumidityRecord
This class represents a Humidity record, and is stored as Json object in the Database.
ICoordinates  
IHumidities  
IHumidity  
InputForm  
InputFormArgument  
InputFormListener  
InputRestrictions  
IsReadOnlyException  
Main
main entry to program.
MainCli
This is the main FrameManager for the CLI version of Umidity.
The CLI version is still under development and therefore still not much optimized nor well documented.
MainFrame
This class is used to handle program's main Frame
MainFrame allows you to add the program into the System Tray instead of closing it.
MainGui
This class handles the MainFrame GUI
OneCall  
OneCallHistoricalResponse

OneCallResponse.RainSnow  
Pair<T,​Y>
A Pair object contains a pair of objects.
RecordsListener
Database events listener interface.
Implement this interface whenever you need to handle DatabaseManager events.
Response
Interface for Response classes
ScreenMenu  
ScreenText  
SettingsFrame
This clas is used to handle Settings Frame
SettingsGui
This class handles SettngsFrame GUI
Single
Contains all useful information about a single response.
Generally, this should be the correct alternative for each Response type for Umidity, as this contains the really essential information.
However, sometimes it may be useful to directly use the "raw" response classes, in which case you should visit the OpenWeather official documentation as some part of the code is left undocumented to avoid redundancy.
StatsCalculator
Calculate Humidity statistics such as Minimum, Maximum, Average and Variance.
TextInput  
UserSettings
This class provides the user settings
WaitEvent
Make the form wait 'till milliseconds in argument has passed.
WaitForInput  
Weather
General weather class.
